intro: Hippion prostratum, commonly known as the prostrate hippion, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit with hairy stems and broad, heart-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically pink or purple, with five petals and stamens that are prominent in appearance. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal or wetland habitats.
